channel.title: C, C++, C# - Which one is best?
channel.description:
Vote for your favorite.
I hate them all :)

item.title: C, C++, C# - Which one is best?
item.dc:creator: @sparkz sparkz
item.description:
@sparkz wrote:

J# is barely used and “is Microsoft’s implementation of the Java programming language. It is specifically designed to allow Java-language developers to easily transition to the .NET Framework and to create .NET applications.”

Java hello world:

class Hello { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("hello world"); } }

c# hello world:

class Hello
{
    static void Main() {
        System.Console.WriteLine("hello, world");
    }
}

Java try/catch statement:

static int F(int a, int b) { if (b == 0) throw new Exception("Divide by zero"); return a / b; } public static void main(String[] args) { try { System.out.println(F(5, 0)); }catch(Exception e) { System.out.println("Error"); } }

c# try/catch statement

static int F(int a, int b) { if (b == 0) throw new Exception("Divide by zero"); return a / b; } static void Main() { try { Console.WriteLine(F(5, 0)); }catch(Exception e) { Console.WriteLine("Error"); } }

(yes i stole the code, don’t rape me)

As far as I can see, J# was Microsoft’s attempt at trying to get Java developers to jump on the .NET bandwagon and start to use .NET, whereas C# was designed more as a competitor to Java, by basically copying it.

Read full topic
item.source: C, C++, C# - Which one is best?

item.title: C, C++, C# - Which one is best?
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“sparkz, post:28, topic:112984”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=161547.msg1531543#msg1531543 date=1182507997]

I personally like C#, although I haven’t tried c++ very much.
C# is easy to use and for me atleast the learning curve was very little.

i dont like c# very muh simply because it is a microsoft take on java, kinda like the zune and the ipod, ive never tried C but C++ is very useful

C# is microsofts take on C++.

J# is what you were thinking of.
[/quote]

Incorrect, C# IS Microsoft’s attempt at creating a similar language to Java.[/quote]

Alright, then what is J#?

Read full topic

item.title: C, C++, C# - Which one is best?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Well, C# is relatively new, no? Think about how Java was when it first came out. It was insanely slow. Look at it now and it almost matches the speeds of C++.

But Microsoft lacks the ability to improve, hence Vista.

Read full topic
item.source: C, C++, C# - Which one is best?

item.title: C, C++, C# - Which one is best?
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

It is rather pointless to compare these.

C is the original language.

C++ is an improved version of C++, and as such, it will be better than C for the 99% of the projects. The exception could be very low level programming.

C# is a pure .NET language, with a syntax similar to C++ and Java, very high level, fully object oriented, and not compiled. For that reason, it is slower and less efficient than C++. It seems to be slower than Java too.

Read full topic

item.title: C, C++, C# - Which one is best?
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:13, topic:112984”]I like C most. It has a very clear implementation, and the code you write gets compiled exactly into what you want, without the compiler adding too much garbage to it.
I would say C++ if it didn’t have all those “gotcha”'s, like auto-destructing objects you weren’t done with, or massive hacking to handle multiple inheritance effectively.[/quote]

Variables, in C and C++, are destroyed when they go out of scope. Dynamically allocate them to prevent that from happenning

Read full topic

item.title: C, C++, C# - Which one is best?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

I like C most. It has a very clear implementation, and the code you write gets compiled exactly into what you want, without the compiler adding too much garbage to it.
I would say C++ if it didn’t have all those “gotcha”'s, like auto-destructing objects you weren’t done with, or massive hacking to handle multiple inheritance effectively.

Read full topic
